knimeNode.name: Unpivot
knimeNode.shortDescription: Introduces new rows (and column(s)) based on the column name structure.

fullDescription.intro:
Converts a table -based on its column's names- to another table. The parts of the names will become values.
The column names can be changed by clicking on the preview table (only for the new ones).
Example usage:
Input columns:
apple-A
apple-B
pear-A
pear-B
other1
other2
Here are sample Patterns:
apple-([AB])
(apple-[AB])
pear(-[AB])
(apple|pear)-([AB])
(apple|pear)-(?:[AB])
other([12])
(.*)e(.*)
These will result in a table with the following columns (check in the preview):
pear-A, pear-B, other1, other2, Col_0 (you can change the name), apple-
pear-A, pear-B, other1, other2, Col_0 (you can change the name), <empty0>
apple-A, apple-B, other1, other2, Col_0 (you can change the name), pear
other1, other2, Col_1 (you can change the name), Col_0 (you can change the name), -
other1, other2, Col_0 (you can change the name), -A, -B
apple-A, apple-B, pear-A, pear-B, Col_0 (you can change the name), other
Col_1 (you can change the name), Col_0 (you can change the name), e
See also: sample workflow.
fullDescription.option: A regular expression on column names. The non-capturing group part is denoted by (?:something), the capturing group parts will create the new columns. It shows the result structure.
